text: The Tale of Custard the Dragon is a poem for children written by Ogden Nash. A picture book of the 1936 poem with illustrations by Lynn M. Munsinger was published in 1995.The Tale of Custard the Dragon, 1st edition, at WorldCat The poem has been described as "probably his most famous poem for kids". In 1959, it inspired Leonard Lipton to write a poem that evolved into the song "Puff, the Magic Dragon". ==References== Category:1936 poems Category:1995 children's books Category:Children's poetry Category:American picture books Category:Fictional dragons
